alert.note: Alert for San Juan (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 16 at 5:30PM MDT until August 16 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern San Juan County in northwestern New Mexico... * Until 800 PM MDT. * At 530 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing very heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.75 and 2.25 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.50 to 1.00 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. High flows are likely Captain Tom Wash east of Newcomb. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Newcomb, Burnham and Sheep Springs. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not enter or cross flowing water or water of unknown depth.
